comments.body: This is a duplicate of an already outstanding post
Yes we should
FREEDOM

It pisses me off that we cant already do this. It's so basic and can already be done through other means that force you to fiddle with your settings. All I wanted was to play on a server with my friends but realms have the most garbage render distance and simulated chunk distance. I can't even make an item sorter without it breaking because the chunks were out of range, and now the second option being my own server won't work because my friends on Xbox cant join.

They are too busy milking realms and the marketplace to bother giving us basic freedom and also because there are too many kids with irresponsible parents who let their kids access inappropriate content by not monitoring what they do.
New boss ocean boss
It looks like a good idea, but I fear it would just result in a lot of mason villagers dying on accident because of the AI.
I beg for this, it's such a pain having to deal with the normal 16x16x16 limit.
The ability to have multiple "minecraft:collision_box"s would be an invaluable addition for creating custom blocks!
Make the pets hate being carried and scratch you
This would definitely be smart to add because no one likes to see their pet die to a creeper blast. This could make it easier to get them out of the way of the chaos that is Minecraft.
it's a great idea
Yes. This is one of the few forum posts that actually matches mojangs sense of humor/ style. I think this needs to be added
Good

Withers or creepers for that matter. I just suffered such a loss when 4 creepers spawned in front of me and blew me away and all my stuff. Very hard not to just stop playing Minecraft forever after already spending an eternity mining the debris.

I am good with the idea of Picaspy. The logic at the moment does not make sense, they say netherite and ancient debris can't be blown up, or can't be burnt. Well, when creepers, wither or even tnt just blows up, or sends explosive that then blows up all the items in the blowing radius just blows up. It doesn't make sense at the time, but maybe you guys, Mojang, can change that. Thanks for understanding us.
I seriously lost a full set of god armor to a wither death and this stuff is fireproof and is found as a high blast resistance block
This just happened to me. I was flying away from the fight with elytra. I had a full set of enchanted netherite armor and he got me mid air. Hundreds of hours of progress gone in an instant.
they just added it

If they added this this would be the hardest achievement
Isn‚Äôt this the same as Adventuring Time? Or does Adventuring Time not have other dimensions?
You could write the lore text in a book, the title of which would become the name of the weapon.
Makes sence, as the piglins are more like ooh than, oh!

That seems like it would be difficult to manage because of the golem's 2-wide 3-tall block size. I'd say they could add mini golems that only use 2 iron blocks (like a snowman) that moved faster but did less damage and had less health, but we already have dogs, so I don't know.
That would defeat the purpose of making iron golems to protect a village. Plus, that would be a little over powered if you always had an iron golem protecting you from mobs.
I don't know any people who would use this gamemode. If you wanna make a house for survival without finding the blocks, build it in creative, and switch to survival.
Or if you want to build it in survival, give yourself all of the items and then build it in survival

I think potentially a few more gamemodes could be implemented into the game, and this is certainly one of them. There could also be a Survival Mode where you can fly, and a Creative Mode where you cannot access commands or command blocks.
Great idea.
‚ÄúCall me the DJ‚Äù Would include the new ‚ÄúPigstep‚Äù CD, and would be a challenge advancement, awarding 50 experience.
I would call the second advancement "Disc Jockey"
Really they should power a furnace, and then leave behind the netherrack itself
It could cook it and turn into netherack but it should only cook items very slowly because it will burn for the same time as lava but cook slower than anything else
This is a good idea. Also if the mobs got more HP and dmg would be great.
hmmm

How would you get the enchantment?

Wither rose + book in crafting?
he explained it above but i like the wither rose idea.
Yeah. Also fast flight deceleration is a thing on Bedrock Edition.

I agree with your suggestion. Java edition is difficult to create in because of the slippery flying. It drifts like ice and gives some people motion sickness. A controller is nearly impossible to use on Java edition with a controller mod. I wish there was a toggle so players could choose to have it on or off.

I totally agree, even trying to move in Creative Mode is a complete nightmare in Java edition. Place the blocks is sooo hard and soooo slow to do it precisely.

I didn't experienced any of this complications in Bedrock, but I can't do what I want to build in Bedrock.

I just don't understand why changing the version is like playing a whole diferent game. It's frustrating.
Try Bedrock Edition!
I am moving from bedrock and it is very disorienting.

I agree, but it shouldn't be too overpowered that you heal all your hearts back. Maybe just 2-3 hearts regenerated every time you sleep, and since you don't eat while you're sleeping, I'd say you'd lose 1 hunger slot after you sleep.
Yeah, I think you should get all your hearts back but gain no hunger back
How about instead insomnia can give you damage, so the bed prevents it?
Yeah I think that you shouldn't regain hunger while you sleep but I like the idea of regaining health.
This used to be an early feature that you could do. You could sleep in a bed and be topped up the next day.
If this was in game the player can just wear two sets of enchanted diamond armor which would be way too overpowered.

This is a cool idea - leather and chainmail would have more purpose. If Mojang integrated this with a 'weight' system, it would make this a cool mechanic. Iron, Gold and diamond armour (for the sake of this argument) would be classed as heavy armour, therefore making moving speeds or maybe just sprinting slower. Whilst leather and chainmail offer less protection, they don't slow you down. By doubling up, you could achieve the maximum armour level, but it would make you even slower, and make fighting a little harder. This would add to the adventure of the game.
Blast Burner, I agree. Bed Wars would be ruinedüò¢üòÇ
Lupinuswolfe that would make double armor a lot more balanced

@Blast Burner

You said:

If this was in game the player can just wear two sets of enchanted diamond armor which would be way too overpowered.

My reply:

You didn't read the part where it said the prerequisite is the bottom layer being weaker. Also, players would have to go throw the hard work of getting not one but two enchanted diamond armor sets if that wasn't a prerequisite.

@ArrivedBird6510  Even if the bottom layer of the armor was weaken that would still be very overpowered. Also, it's pretty easy to make really good armor when you have easy guardian farm tutorials and a system where you can just switch a villagers trades with ease.

This would only work if armors were classified between plate armor and leather/chain armor.

Knights in the medieval ages would wear gambeson (thick cloth armor, the main shock absorber) underneath chainmail (which protected the gambison from being damaged) underneath plate armor (which protected the shock-absorbing gambison while providing additional shock absorption in the form of dents)

Leather armor was practically useless in combat as any sharp weapon could cut it and it did nothing against anything worse than a glancing blow. Not to mention ZERO shock absorption. It could be used as cheap chainmail.

Knights were actually quite mobile in their armor. People have been able to do parkour in the full three layers of armour. The problem was endurance, they could not do it for as long.

Layering armor should increase the rate at which you get hungry.

Armor values would work very differently if armor layering was introduced realistically and balanced.

I added cloth armor because that is what was used in medieval times and was integral to actual armor.

All armors would provide a relatively low armor value:

leather-1/2

cloth/chain-2

plate-2 1/2

 

Different armors would be stacked differently

Absorbers- cloth, leather

Mail- leather, chainmail

Plate- everything else

Cannot layer- the turtle shell and elytra may not be stackable for balancing reasons

 

only the top layer would take damage

mail- when an absorber armor is present, it is there to protect that layer, so it provides half its armor rating

plate armor would add its armor rating (2 1/2) plus its armor quality (gold's would be 1/2, iron would be 1, diamond would be 1 1/2, and netherite would be 2 or something to that effect) times the absorber layer's armor value. If there is no absorber layer, the absorber layer armor value is treated as 1/2 the Mail layer(when there is one) or just 1/2 (when there isn't)

The protection enchantment would add and armor rating of 1/4 per level, and while your armor bar exceeds the max, (10) it would convert extra into durability.

You can only stack one of each layer type. It seems really complicated on paper, and coding it will be complex, but using  it in-game will be much easier. I have some examples.

leather + leather + diamond = 4

cloth + chain + netherite = 9 1/2

cloth + leather + gold = 5 1/4

cloth + chain + diamond = 8 1/2

max is 10

Armor layers would still max out defence at 10 (a full bar) but anything over 10 would convert to absorption effect or temporary durability.

When I refer to different kinds of armor, I'm referring to full sets (including in my last post) so the value of armor points will have to be changed.

Temporary durability would be added to the whole armor set and would go away when something is taken away when you change your armor (by that I mean when your helmet breaks the temporary armor points do not go away, but when you try to replace it they do) it would be about 100 points per 1/4 armor point over the maximum

 

Or maybe there could be a second armor bar, maxing out defence at 20. the second armor bar would appear when you exceed the first bar (in which case the armor values in my last post would be more varied)

Armor points would be worth slightly less, though, rather than significantly more.
Then you‚Äôll have emeralds for day's
That would be too OP
Option 3 is best

How about option to completely disable the sweeping attack. I know that there are # of unrealistic things in Minecraft but at least to me those are understandable as game mechanics but in my opinion sweeping attacks for completely unrealistic and poor for game mechanics (same goes for martial arts sweeping kicks shown in movies).

If somebody wants to have it then after they said yes to have it, then provide 1 of the controls requested above.

For me, after learning the basics of the game and dying few times trying to understand how to works, my first death was when my game updated to 1.9 and I was in my first fight. Since then I have downgraded the game and will never play Minecraft EVER again with sweeping attack present
